Legacy: Season 1","sortindex":"1","primaryname":"1","translit":"Pandemic Legacy: Season 1"},"description":"<p><em><strong>Pandemic Legacy<\/strong><\/em> is a co-operative campaign game, with an overarching story-arc played through 12-24 sessions, depending on how well your group does at the game. At the beginning, the game starts very similar to basic <em><a  href=\"\/boardgame\/30549\/pandemic\"   >Pandemic<\/a><\/em>, in which your team of disease-fighting specialists races against the clock to travel around the world, treating disease hotspots while researching cures for each of four plagues before they get out of hand.<\/p>\n\n<p>During a player's turn, they have four actions available, with which they may travel around in the world in various ways (sometimes needing to discard a card), build structures like research stations, treat diseases (removing one cube from the board; if all cubes of a color have been removed, the disease has been eradicated), trade cards with other players, or find a cure for a disease (requiring five cards of the same color to be discarded while at a research station). Each player has a unique role with special abilities to help them at these actions.<\/p>\n\n<p>After a player has taken their actions, they draw two cards. These cards can include epidemic cards, which will place new disease cubes on the board, and can lead to an outbreak, spreading disease cubes even further. Outbreaks additionally increase the panic level of a city, making that city more expensive to travel to.<\/p>\n\n<p>Each month in the game, you have two chances to achieve that month's objectives. If you succeed, you win and immediately move on to the next month. If you fail, you have a second chance, with more funding for beneficial event cards.<\/p>\n\n<p>During the campaign, new rules and components will be introduced. These will sometimes require you to permanently alter the components of the game; this includes writing on cards, ripping up cards, and placing permanent stickers on components. Your characters can gain new skills, or detrimental effects. A character can even be lost entirely, at which point it's no longer available for play.<\/p>\n\n<p>Part of the <a class=\"\" href=\"\/wiki\/page\/Pandemic_series#\">Pandemic series<\/a><\/p>\n\n","wiki":"<p><a name=\"Contents\"><\/a>\t\t\t\t<div id=\"toc0\">\n\t\t\t\t\t<h3>Contents<\/h3><\/p>\n\n<ul>\n    <li> 1 Epic-sized game board, showing the world&rsquo;s major cities and their status<\/li>\n    <li> 1 Rulebook<\/li>\n    <li> 5 Role cards<\/li>\n    <li> 4 Pawns<\/li>\n    <li> 61 Player cards<ul>\n        <li> 48 City cards<\/li>\n        <li> 5 Epidemic cards<\/li>\n        <li> 8 Event cards<\/li>\n    <\/ul><\/li>\n    <li> 4 Reference cards<\/li>\n    <li> 48 Infection cards<\/li>\n    <li> 62 Legacy cards<\/li>\n    <li> 4 Civilian cards<\/li>\n    <li> 5 Dossiers and 1 Sticker sheet<\/li>\n    <li> 4 Cure markers<\/li>\n    <li> 2 Track markers<ul>\n        <li> 1 Infection rate marker<\/li>\n        <li> 1 Outbreak marker<\/li>\n    <\/ul><\/li>\n    <li> 1 Reminder token<\/li>\n    <li> 96 Disease cubes<ul>\n        <li> 24 in 4 colors<\/li>\n    <\/ul><\/li>\n    <li> 6 Research stations<\/li>\n<\/ul>\n\n<p>And many surprises!<\/p>\n\n<p><\/div><a name=\"Microbadges\"><\/a>\t\t\t\t<div id=\"toc1\">\n\t\t\t\t\t<h3>Microbadges<\/h3><\/p>\n\n<p><a href=\"\/microbadge\/35341\"><img alt='mb'  onmouseover=\"return name=\"FAQ\"><\/a>\t\t\t\t<div id=\"toc3\">\n\t\t\t\t\t<h3>FAQ<\/h3><\/p>\n\n<p>A compiled FAQ can be found here: <strong><a  href=\"\/thread\/1470601\/compiled-faq-spoilers-hidden-each-month-hidden-sep\"   >Compiled FAQ (Spoilers Hidden, each month hidden Separately)<\/a><\/strong><br \/>\nEach month is hidden separately and it's specifically constructed so you can find the answer to your question without being spoiled on anything.<br \/>\nPlease check this FAQ before posting in the rules forum, thank you.<\/p>\n\n<p>A month by month spoiler protected reference of the contents of the Legacy Deck, all the Dossier Doors, and packages 1-8 is here <strong><a hidden)<\/a><\/strong><br \/>\nIt only has spoilers up to the beginning of February, and those are hidden in a spoiler block.<\/p>\n\n<p><\/div><a name=\"German_translation\"><\/a>\t\t\t\t<div class="text-block ng-hide" href="/boardgame/161936/pandemic-legacy-season-1/linkeditems/reimplements" ng-show="::showmore" ui-sref="geekitem.linkeditems.reimplements">     + -3<span> more</span> </a> </popup-list> </div> </li><!-- --> <!-- --> <!-- --> <!-- --> </ul> </div> </div><!-- --> </classifications-module> </div> <!-- --><div class="game-description-ad" hide-ad-block="blockrectangle" ng-class="{ 'game-description-ad-wide': geekitemctrl.geekitem.data.item.versioninfo.kickstarter_widget_url &amp;&amp; geekitemctrl.geekitem.data.item.versioninfo.premiumkickstarter}"> <kickstarter-module geekitem="geekitemctrl.geekitem"> <!-- --> </kickstarter-module> <shopify-module geekitem="geekitemctrl.geekitem"> <!-- --> </shopify-module> <!-- --><div class="hidden-xs advertisement-amazon-banner" ng-if="!geekitemctrl.geekitem.data.item.versioninfo.kickstarter_widget_url &amp;&amp; !geekitemctrl.geekitem.data.item.versioninfo.premiumkickstarter"> <amazonad objectid="geekitemctrl.geekitemParams.objectid" objecttype="geekitemctrl.geekitemParams.objecttype"><iframe frameborder="0" marginheight="0" marginwidth="0" scrolling="no" style="width:120px;height:240px;"></iframe> </amazonad> <div class="advertisement-text-footer"> 						Advertisement 					</div> </div><!-- --> </div> <div class="game-description"> <div class="panel panel-condensed panel-expandable expandable" expandable-height="300px" gk-expandable-geekitem="description"><div class="expandable-envelope" ng-style="{maxHeight:expandablectrl.maxHeight}" style="max-height: 300px;"> <div class="expandable-body" ng-transclude=""> <article class="game-description-body"> <div ng-bind-html="geekitemctrl.wikitext|to_trusted"><p><em><strong>Pandemic Legacy</strong></em> is a co-operative campaign game, with an overarching story-arc played through 12-24 sessions, depending on how well your group does at the game. At the beginning, the game starts very similar to basic <em><a href="/boardgame/30549/pandemic">Pandemic</a></em>, in which your team of disease-fighting specialists races against the clock to travel around the world, treating disease hotspots while researching cures for each of four plagues before they get out of hand.</p>
<p>During a player's turn, they have four actions available, with which they may travel around in the world in various ways (sometimes needing to discard a card), build structures like research stations, treat diseases (removing one cube from the board; if all cubes of a color have been removed, the disease has been eradicated), trade cards with other players, or find a cure for a disease (requiring five cards of the same color to be discarded while at a research station). Each player has a unique role with special abilities to help them at these actions.</p>
<p>After a player has taken their actions, they draw two cards. These cards can include epidemic cards, which will place new disease cubes on the board, and can lead to an outbreak, spreading disease cubes even further. Outbreaks additionally increase the panic level of a city, making that city more expensive to travel to.</p>
<p>Each month in the game, you have two chances to achieve that month's objectives. If you succeed, you win and immediately move on to the next month. If you fail, you have a second chance, with more funding for beneficial event cards.</p>
<p>During the campaign, new rules and components will be introduced. These will sometimes require you to permanently alter the components of the game; this includes writing on cards, ripping up cards, and placing permanent stickers on components. Your characters can gain new skills, or detrimental effects. A character can even be lost entirely, at which point it's no longer available for play.</p>
<p>Part of the <a class="" href="/wiki/page/Pandemic_series#">Pandemic series</a></p>
</div> </article> </div> <p class="expandable-overlay"></p> </div> <div class="opener"> <a ng-click="expandablectrl.open($event)" ng-href="">+ More</a> </div> <div class="closer"> <a <h3>Contents</h3><p></p>
<ul>
<li> 1 Epic-sized game board, showing the world’s major cities and their status</li>
<li> 1 Rulebook</li>
<li> 5 Role cards</li>
<li> 4 Pawns</li>
<li> 61 Player cards<ul>
<li> 48 City cards</li>
<li> 5 Epidemic cards</li>
<li> 8 Event cards</li>
</ul></li>
<li> 4 Reference cards</li>
<li> 48 Infection cards</li>
<li> 62 Legacy cards</li>
<li> 4 Civilian cards</li>
<li> 5 Dossiers and 1 Sticker sheet</li>
<li> 4 Cure markers</li>
<li> 2 Track markers<ul>
<li> 1 Infection rate marker</li>
<li> 1 Outbreak marker</li>
</ul></li>
<li> 1 Reminder token</li>
<li> 96 Disease cubes<ul>
<li> 24 in 4 colors</li>
</ul></li>
<li> 6 Research stations</li>
</ul>
<p>And many surprises!</p>
<p></p></div><a name="Microbadges"></a> <div id="toc1">
<h3>Microbadges</h3><p></p>

<p></p></div><a name="Card_Sleeves"></a> <div id="toc2">
<h3><a class="" href="/wiki/page/Card_Sleeves#">Card_Sleeves</a>:</h3><p></p>
<ul>
<li> <a class="" href="/wiki/page/Card_Sleeves_-_Standard#">Standard</a> (63.5 x 88mm, <a class="" href="/wiki/page/Card_Sleeve_Reference#toc1">reference</a>) for 109 cards<ul>
<li> 61 Player cards</li>
<li> 48 Infection cards</li>
</ul></li>
</ul>
<p></p></div><a name="FAQ"></a> <div id="toc3">
<h3>FAQ</h3><p></p>
<p>A compiled FAQ can be found here: <strong><a href="/thread/1470601/compiled-faq-spoilers-hidden-each-month-hidden-sep">Compiled FAQ (Spoilers Hidden, each month hidden Separately)</a></strong><br/>
Each month is hidden separately and it's specifically constructed so you can find the answer to your question without being spoiled on anything.<br/>
Please check this FAQ before posting in the rules forum, thank you.</p>
<p>A month by month spoiler protected reference of the contents of the Legacy Deck, all the Dossier Doors, and packages 1-8 is here <strong><a href="/thread/1500066/full-game-spoilers-numbered-contents-all-legacy-co">[FULL GAME SPOILERS] Numbered Contents of all the Legacy Components</a></strong></p>
<p>This thread contains a list of common mistakes in the first few games: <strong><a href="/thread/1512640/commonly-overlooked-rules-and-early-game-mistakes">Commonly Overlooked Rules and Early Game Mistakes (Spoilers hidden)</a></strong><br/>
It only has spoilers up to the beginning of February, and those are hidden in a spoiler block.</p>
<p></p></div><a name="German_translation"></a> <div id="toc4">
<h3>German translation</h3><p></p>
<p>Errata bezüglich der Deutschen Übersetzung finden sich (spoilerfrei) hier: <strong><a href="/thread/1452590/deutsch-german-zentraler-thread-deutsche-errata-sp">DEUTSCH / German: Zentraler Thread Deutsche Errata (Spoilerfrei!)</a></strong></p>
<p></p></div><a name="Dutch_translation"></a> <div id="toc5">
<h3>Dutch translation</h3><p></p>
<p>You can find errata for the Dutch version here (spoilers hidden): <strong><a href="/thread/1462714/translation-errors-dutch-version-no-spoilers">Translation errors in the Dutch version (no spoilers)</a></strong></p>
<p></p></div><a name="Common_ThreadsPolls"></a> <div id="toc6">
<h3>Common Threads/Polls</h3><p></p>
<ul>
<li> January Spoiler: Disease Color<ul>
<li> <strong><a href="/article/21301334#21301334">Poll - What colour will be your downfall? (Jan spoiler)</a></strong></li>
<li> <strong><a href="/article/21063102#21063102">***SPOILER*** Which Disease</a></strong></li>
<li> <strong><a href="/article/20596475#20596475">Poll on one of the first legacy components in the game - ***SPOILERS JANUARY***</a></strong></li>
<li> <strong><a href="/article/20755092#20755092">What were your choices in January - SPOILERS </a></strong></li>
<li> <strong><a href="/article/22142084#22142084">Poll: What color is [January spoiler] in your game?</a></strong></li>
</ul></li>
</ul>
<ul>
<li> Total Games Played<ul>
<li> <strong><a href="/article/20898982#20898982">How many games did you play up to the end of your Legacy Experience? *NO spoilers*</a></strong></li>
<li> <strong><a href="/article/21335793#21335793">How well did you do in the game? (ENTIRE season 1 spoilers!!!)</a></strong></li>
<li> <strong><a href="/article/20625156#20625156">Poll: Did you win?? (Spoiler-free)</a></strong></li>
</ul></li>
</ul>
<ul>
<li> Post Campaign Comparison<ul>
<li> <strong><a href="/thread/1460887/those-who-have-finished">For those who have finished.</a></strong></li>
<li> <strong><a href="/thread/1457925/scores-and-characters-through-december-spoilers">Scores and Characters through December- SPOILERS -</a></strong></li>
<li> <strong><a href="/thread/1467104/compare-final-results-spoilers">Compare final results (spoilers)</a></strong></li>
<li> <strong><a href="/thread/1490914/end-game-december-spoilers-post-game-summary-list">[End Game - December Spoilers] Post Game Summary list</a></strong></li>
</ul></li>
</ul>

[<a class="ng-hide" href="/boardgame/161936/pandemic-legacy-season-1" ng-show="!geekitemctrl.geekitem.data.item.imagepagehref" no-animate="" ui-sref="geekitem.overview"> <img class="img-responsive" data-no-retina="true" ng-src="https://cf.geekdo-images.com/n8626bWQOoE_1nqvLUXi_6QfYO0=/fit-in/246x300/pic2452831.png" no-animate="" src="https://cf.geekdo-images.com/n8626bWQOoE_1nqvLUXi_6QfYO0=/fit-in/246x300/pic2452831.png"/> </a>, <a href="/boardgame/161936/pandemic-legacy-season-1" ng-href="/boardgame/161936/pandemic-legacy-season-1" ui-sref="geekitem.overview"> \t\t\t\t\t\t\t\tPandemic Legacy: Season 1 \t\t\t\t\t\t\t</a>]
Pandemic Legacy: Season 1

8.7
In [33]:
# Description
print (soup_subpage.find('meta', {'name':'description'})['content'])

Pandemic Legacy is a co-operative campaign game, with an overarching story-arc played through 12-24 sessions, depending on how well your group does at the game. At the beginning, the game starts very similar to basic Pandemic, in which your team of disease-fighting specialists races against the clock to travel around the world, treating disease hotspots while researching cures for each of four plagues before they get out of hand.

During a player's turn, they have four actions available, with which they may travel around in the world in various ways (sometimes needing to discard a card), build structures like research stations, treat diseases (removing one cube from the board; if all cubes of a color have been removed, the disease has been eradicated), trade cards with other players, or find a cure for a disease (requiring five cards of the same color to be discarded while at a research station). Each player has a unique role with special abilities to help them at these actions.

After a player has taken their actions, they draw two cards. These cards can include epidemic cards, which will place new disease cubes on the board, and can lead to an outbreak, spreading disease cubes even further. Outbreaks additionally increase the panic level of a city, making that city more expensive to travel to.

Each month in the game, you have two chances to achieve that month's objectives. If you succeed, you win and immediately move on to the next month. If you fail, you have a second chance, with more funding for beneficial event cards.

During the campaign, new rules and components will be introduced. These will sometimes require you to permanently alter the components of the game; this includes writing on cards, ripping up cards, and placing permanent stickers on components. Your characters can gain new skills, or detrimental effects. A character can even be lost entirely, at which point it's no longer available for play.

Part of the Pandemic series
In [34]:
import sqlite3

conn = sqlite3.connect('boardgame.sqlite')
cursor = conn.cursor()
cursor.execute('''CREATE TABLE boardgame
                  ( ID INTEGER PRIMARY KEY AUTOINCREMENT,
                    board_name CHAR(256) NOT NULL,
                    url CHAR(256) NOT NULL,
                    rating CHAR(256) NOT NULL,
                    description text NOT NULL
                    );''')
conn.commit()
conn.close()
In [35]:
board_name = soup_subpage.find_all('a',{'ui-sref':'geekitem.overview'})[1].text.replace('\t','').replace('"','\'').strip()
url = link
rating = soup_subpage.find_all('span', {'ng-show':'showRating'})[0].text.replace('\t','').strip()
description = soup_subpage.find('meta', {'name':'description'})['content']
conn = sqlite3.connect('boardgame.sqlite')
cursor = conn.cursor()
command = "INSERT INTO boardgame (board_name, url, rating, description) VALUES (\'%s\', \'%s\', \'%s\', \"%s\");" % (board_name, url, rating, description)
cursor.execute(command)
conn.commit()
conn.close()
In [46]:
from selenium import webdriver
from bs4 import BeautifulSoup
import requests
import time
import random
import sqlite3

conn = sqlite3.connect('boardgame.sqlite')
cursor = conn.cursor()
#build database
cursor.execute('''CREATE TABLE boardgame
                  ( ID INTEGER PRIMARY KEY AUTOINCREMENT,
                    board_name CHAR(256) NOT NULL,
                    url CHAR(256) NOT NULL,
                    rating CHAR(256) NOT NULL,
                    description text NOT NULL
                    );''')
conn.commit()
#total_page = 956
total_page = 1
for page in range(1,total_page+1):
    #main_page
    r_mainpage= requests.get('https://boardgamegeek.com/browse/boardgame/page/%d' % page)
    soup_mainpage = BeautifulSoup(r_mainpage.content,'lxml')
    tables = soup.find_all(id="row_")
    #get_links
    links = list()
    for table in tables:
        url = 'https://boardgamegeek.com' + table.find_all('a')[1]['href']
        links.append(url)
    #get each subpage    
    for link in links[:10]:
        driver = webdriver.PhantomJS(executable_path='./phantomjs.exe')
        driver.get(link)
        pageSource = driver.page_source
        driver.close()  
        soup_subpage = BeautifulSoup(pageSource,'lxml')
        #get features
        board_name = soup_subpage.find_all('a',{'ui-sref':'geekitem.overview'})[1].text.replace('\t','').replace('"','\'').strip()
        url = link
        rating = soup_subpage.find_all('span', {'ng-show':'showRating'})[0].text.replace('\t','').strip()
        description = soup_subpage.find('meta', {'name':'description'})['content']
        #sql insert
        command = "INSERT INTO boardgame (board_name, url, rating, description) VALUES (\'%s\', \'%s\', \'%s\', \"%s\");" % (board_name, url, rating, description)
        cursor.execute(command)
        conn.commit()
        time.sleep(2)
conn.close()
In [47]:
conn = sqlite3.connect('boardgame.sqlite')
cursor = conn.cursor()
cursor.execute("SELECT * FROM boardgame")
row = cursor.fetchall()
conn.close()
print (len(row))
